content.body: Details posted. Apparently code has been in place for about a decade...

annevk: https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/a7b863a49945946c913e6e194ec047da844094a4/Source/WebCore/html/HTMLMediaElement.cpp#L5404 responds to inserting `source` elements, and https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/a7b863a49945946c913e6e194ec047da844094a4/Source/WebCore/html/HTMLMediaElement.cpp#L886 ("end tag seen") only invokes text track selection, so it looks to me like WebKit follows the spec's model to try `source` elements in order during parsing
content.formatted_body: annevk: https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/a7b863a49945946c913e6e194ec047da844094a4/Source/WebCore/html/HTMLMediaElement.cpp#L5404 responds to inserting source elements, and https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/a7b863a49945946c913e6e194ec047da844094a4/Source/WebCore/html/HTMLMediaElement.cpp#L886 ("end tag seen") only invokes text track selection, so it looks to me like WebKit follows the spec's model to try source elements in order during parsing

content.body: but I may be missing something
zcorpan: I think the blog post is mistaken, yeah.
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: I think the blog post is mistaken, yeah.

content.body: annevk: so are software-only formats rejected on iOS?
content.formatted_body: annevk: so are software-only formats rejected on iOS?

content.body: The existence of `track` relying on the media element end tag being seen does make the overall proposal more acceptable, though still not a big fan personally.
content.formatted_body: The existence of track relying on the media element end tag being seen does make the overall proposal more acceptable, though still not a big fan personally.
